transportAdvice: The Dead Sea area has no meaningful public transit, so most visitors arrive by private car, rental vehicle, or organized tour from Amman, which is roughly an hour's drive away. Taxis are available but should be negotiated in advance, and walking between resorts or attractions along the shoreline is generally impractical due to distances and heat.

weather.description: Mild and occasionally rainy, making it one of the cooler and more pleasant months to visit.
Still mild with some chance of rain, but increasingly sunny days make it comfortable for outdoor activities.
Warm and mostly dry with pleasant temperatures ideal for floating in the sea and exploring the shoreline.
Hot and dry conditions begin to set in, with long sunny days and very little rainfall.
Noticeably hot with intense sun; early morning visits to the water are recommended to avoid peak heat.
Very hot and almost entirely dry; staying hydrated is essential and midday outdoor activity should be minimized.

Temperatures begin to ease into a more comfortable range, making this a popular month for visitors.
